message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The lymphatic drainage of the testicles is to the para-aortic lymph nodes. The histopathologic examination shows invasion of adjacent lymphatic vessels, so it is likely that malignant cells have spread to the para-aortic lymph nodes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mixed germ cell tumor can spread to several lymph node regions, but the most common site of metastasis is the para-aortic lymph nodes. Beta-hCG elevation is common with choriocarcinoma, which is a type of germ cell tumor that can metastasize to the lymph nodes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The lymphatic drainage of the testis is to the para-aortic lymph nodes. The histopathologic examination suggests invasion of adjacent lymphatic vessels, which increases the likelihood of malignant cells in the para-aortic lymph nodes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The testicular tumor is likely to metastasize via the lymphatic system, and the para-aortic lymph nodes are the initial nodal drainage basin for metastasis from the testis. Therefore, further evaluation is likely to show malignant cells in the para-aortic lymph nodes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The lymphatic drainage from the testes is mainly to the para-aortic and interaortocaval nodes. The other options are not in the drainage pathway of the testes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The lymphatic drainage of the testis is to the para-aortic region, making it the most likely site for malignant cells. The external iliac and internal iliac regions drain the lower extremities and pelvic organs. The mediastinal region drains the thoracic organs.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The left testicle drains into the para-aortic lymph nodes, which are the most likely region to show malignant cells in the case of an invasion of adjacent lymphatic vessels. Options A-C are not related to the drainage of the testicles.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Testicular cancer commonly spreads to the retroperitoneal lymph nodes, which includes the para-aortic lymph nodes. The other options are less common sites of metastasis. The elevated β-hCG concentration and mixed germ cell tumor diagnosis also support the suspicion of testicular cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The mixed germ cell tumor is a type of testicular cancer and invasion of adjacent lymphatic vessels suggests metastasis. The most likely lymph node region to show malignant cells is the para-aortic, which drains the testicles.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mixed germ cell tumors are the most common testicular malignancies and often metastasize to the para-aortic lymph nodes. The other options are less likely to be affected.
